entry.title: Evangaline Buckley Begins
entry.summary:
Author: Not_Ren_42

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,902Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 105

Summary: Evangaline Buckley has been alone for most of her life. She was unwanted by her parents and left by her sister when she had the first chance. For her most formative years, she had to go to extreme lengths just to get attention from those meant to care for her, failing more often than not.After finding out the truth about her creation, Evie decides that she has to do something ‚Äì anything. She goes through even more pain and heartbreak before finding herself where she was always meant to end up.

entry.title: peine forte et dure
entry.summary:
Author: graywyck

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,115Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 68

Summary: That would be the pattern. That would be the smart choice, statistically, intuitively. It was his pattern, after all. But once again, he just couldn‚Äôt call a spade a spade, not when his heart was saying, well, ‚ÄúHearts.‚ÄùEddie leaned back a bit, a brief look of surprise in his eyes, before shaking it off entirely.‚ÄúSwitching it up, Buckley?‚Äù He chuckled, bending the card upward so only he could peak. A smile crept across his face, though it looked as if Eddie was biting it back. He held the card fully in his hand now, still shielded from Buck‚Äôs view, and stared at it with an unfamiliar emotion taking shape along the line of his jaw. Finally, rather than setting it on the table, he placed the card into Buck‚Äôs hand, Eddie‚Äôs fingers pressing gently against his palm.More weight. Buck sucked in a breath, pushing ever so slightly into Eddie‚Äôs touch. His thumb finally grabbed onto the card now in his hand, as he finally looked down.A king of hearts.OR- Buck follows the pattern. And despite months of Buck's distance and avoidance, he finds that it always leads back to Eddie.

Why is it wrong if he is like this? It‚Äôs not, and Eddie knows that, but there‚Äôs still this tiny voice in the back of his head screaming at him that he can‚Äôt love a man like he has to love a woman. He digs his head into his open palms and pushes against his eyes in hope to maybe force them out of his head. He‚Äôd rather lose his eyes and bleed to death if it meant he didn‚Äôt have to participate in the wrath of his very religious parents. entry.title: Catch Me, Please
entry.summary:
Author: ALittleSideProject

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,117Chapters: 6/34Kudos: 64

Summary: And all of that was why, on their seventeenth day on Mars, Buck had shoved Eddie out of the way during the emergency evacuation, knowing it meant his own death instead of Eddie‚Äôs. Buck trusted Eddie to help get everyone else home, and Eddie had someone to go home for. Someone who needed him and loved him. Someone who Buck loved, even without ever meeting. He wasn‚Äôt going to let Chris grow up without a father. So in the split second he had to think after seeing the communications dish flying at them through the storm that was chasing them off the planet fourteen days early, he‚Äôd pushed Eddie out of the way, hoping like hell it would be enough and knowing he wouldn‚Äôt live long enough to find out.--Or, take the basic plot of The Martian and stick the 911 characters in there, slap on a lot more angst and pining, and wrap it all up with plenty of recovery cuddling.

entry.title: My blood rushed to the heart
entry.summary:
Author: ufohnoparty (why_didnt_i_get_any_soup)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,712Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 59

Summary: That man‚Äîa man whose eyes had been on Buck, whose lips had been on Buck's and maybe other places too, whose hands had been on Buck‚Äîhad turned his eyes on Eddie, a look of interest, an offer, and Eddie had bolted. Just turned on his heel and ran off without another word to his friends. One minute he was listening to Buck reject an amazing bisexual opportunity, and the next he was in his stupid Prius halfway home already.Or: Eddie is seen, Eddie is jealous, and Eddie goes home to take care of himself.
